title: Compiler panics on nightly compiling `speculate` tests

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: A-macros
labels.description: Area: All kinds of macros (custom derive, macro_rules!, proc macros, ..)

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

body:
I tried compiling some tests written using `speculate` (https://github.com/utkarshkukreti/speculate.rs), and this causes the rust compiler to panic.

I checked a few versions, and it looks like this broke sometime between `rustc 1.26.0-nightly (a04b88d19 2018-03-19)` and `rustc 1.26.0-nightly (f5631d9ac 2018-03-24)`. Apparently it does not compile with `rustc 1.26.0-nightly (a04b88d19 2018-03-19)`, but that's another issue.

Minimal example
---
```rust
#![feature(plugin)]
#![cfg_attr(test, plugin(speculate))]

speculate! {
    describe hello {
        it "panics" {
            assert!(true);
        }
    }
}
```

Correctly fails compiling on
---
```
rustc 1.26.0-nightly (a04b88d19 2018-03-19)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: a04b88d1941644df01fa5e31dd43e0f57c13d938
commit-date: 2018-03-19
host: x86_64-apple-darwin
release: 1.26.0-nightly
LLVM version: 6.0
```

Compilation panics on
---
```
rustc 1.26.0-nightly (f5631d9ac 2018-03-24)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: f5631d9ac7745dd6eaea2bc6c236d5f8e54e9a18
commit-date: 2018-03-24
host: x86_64-apple-darwin
release: 1.26.0-nightly
LLVM version: 6.0
```

Backtrace of `cargo test`
---
```
   Compiling speculate v0.0.26
   Compiling panic v0.1.0 (file:///.../panic)
thread 'main' panicked at 'called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: Diagnostic { level: Fatal, message: [("expected string literal", NoStyle)], code: None, span: MultiSpan { primary_spans: [Span { lo: BytePos(85), hi: BytePos(90), ctxt: #0 }], span_labels: [(Span { lo: BytePos(85), hi: BytePos(90), ctxt: #0 }, "expected string literal")] }, children: [], suggestions: [] }', libcore/result.rs:945:5
stack backtrace:
   0: std::sys::unix::backtrace::tracing::imp::unwind_backtrace
   1: std::sys_common::backtrace::print
   2: std::panicking::default_hook::{{closure}}
   3: std::panicking::default_hook
   4: rustc::util::common::panic_hook
   5: std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook
   6: std::panicking::begin_panic_fmt
   7: rust_begin_unwind
   8: core::panicking::panic_fmt
   9: <syntax::ast::AngleBracketedParameterData as core::clone::Clone>::clone
             at libcore/macros.rs:26
  10: <syntax::ast::AngleBracketedParameterData as core::clone::Clone>::clone
             at libcore/result.rs:782
  11: speculate::parser::parse_describe
             at speculate-0.0.26/src/parser.rs:27
  12: speculate::parser::parse
             at speculate-0.0.26/src/parser.rs:8
  13: speculate::expand_speculate
             at speculate-0.0.26/src/lib.rs:26
  14: <F as syntax::ext::base::TTMacroExpander>::expand
  15: syntax::ext::expand::MacroExpander::expand_invoc
  16: syntax::ext::expand::MacroExpander::expand
  17: syntax::ext::expand::MacroExpander::expand_crate
  18: rustc_driver::driver::phase_2_configure_and_expand_inner::{{closure}}
  19: rustc::util::common::time
  20: rustc_driver::driver::phase_2_configure_and_expand
  21: rustc_driver::driver::compile_input
  22: rustc_driver::run_compiler_with_pool
  23: syntax::with_globals
  24: <std::panic::AssertUnwindSafe<F> as core::ops::function::FnOnce<()>>::call_once
  25: __rust_maybe_catch_panic
  26: rustc_driver::run
  27: rustc_driver::main
  28: std::rt::lang_start::{{closure}}
  29: std::panicking::try::do_call
  30: __rust_maybe_catch_panic
  31: std::rt::lang_start_internal
  32: main
query stack during panic:
end of query stack

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.28.0-nightly (a3085756e 2018-05-19) running on x86_64-apple-darwin

note: compiler flags: -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

error: Could not compile `panic`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```
